This week we witnessed history in the House of Representatives with the removal of Speaker McCarthy.

On Monday I will be hosting a conversation and Q&A at @sacstate to discuss how we got here and what happens next. 

To RSVP, visit the link below: bera.house.gov/forms/form/?I‚Ä¶

After removing the Speaker of the House for the first time in American history, leaving us unable to pass bills, Republican leadership has sent us home for the week.

We have work to do. It is long past time for both parties to come together in a bipartisan way to govern.

Today is a very serious day for our country. House Republicans just took historic and unprecedented action to remove the Speaker of the House.

Read my full statement at the link below:

The House just voted to fund the government for 45 days. 

This disaster was only averted after @HouseDemocrats prevented dangerous cuts to our budget and supported a last minute bill that passed with the support of more Democrats than Republicans. bera.house.gov/news/document‚Ä¶
Congressman Ami Bera's statement on the passing of Senator Diane Feinstein:

As Members of Congress, our most basic duty is to keep the government running.

That's why I joined my colleagues in writing a letter to Speaker McCarthy to work across the isle to prevent a government shutdown. Read more here: bera.house.gov/news/document‚Ä¶

Speaker McCarthy and House Republicans have ground the House to a halt with no plan to fund the government and no attempt to work across the aisle to find compromise. 

The American people don't just deserve a government that works for them, they deserve a government that works.

Congressional Republicans are steering our country towards a government shutdown.

I stand with my @NewDemCoalition colleagues in urging @SpeakerMcCarthy to set aside political games and work in a bipartisan manner to prevent this crisis.

California has and will continue to lead the nation in bold environmental policies that keep our communities safe and healthy.

Rather than seeking to undermine California‚Äôs and other states‚Äô ability to set their own vehicle emissions standards, House Republicans should work collaboratively with California towards a healthier and more sustainable future.

California's vehicle emissions waiver has not only protected families from harmful pollutants for decades, but also fostered job growth and played a pivotal role in our collective fight against climate change.

Today, I voted against a reckless and dangerous Republican-led bill that would block California from setting its own vehicle emissions standards.

This law is lowering costs for hardworking #SacramentoCounty families, investing in America, and unleashing a clean energy boom.
